intro: Didymocarpus minutiserrulatus, commonly known as the small-toothed mangrove, is a species of flowering plant in the family Euphorbiaceae. It is native to Southeast Asia and is typically found in coastal areas, including mangrove forests and brackish water environments. The plant has small, ovate leaves with finely serrated margins, and it produces yellowish flowers that are clustered in umbels. It is adapted to saline conditions and plays a role in stabilizing coastal soil. The fruit is a capsule that splits open to release its seeds.
